page.title: 19Transport In South Kyme
page.content: Many villagers travel to facilities or work in larger villages and towns. Ninety per cent of households own a car, and a number own two or more. Many young people own motor cycles. Most learn to drive at 17 years of age {Bus services :}Local markets, 3 times a week Weekly Bingo at Boston and Great Hale To Lincoln bound trains at Metheringham, 3 times per week The fare to Sleaford is 90 pence each way. There is a free daily service for all school children to Billinghay and Sleaford schools, which fee-paying passengers may use. Deliveries to and from farms are made by lorry or tractor and trailer. A few rowing boats, canoes and a punt are used for leisure on the river.
